author: Gregor Stuart Hunter
title: Global Stock Rout Rolls On in Asia
text:
U.S. stocks flip between gains and losses Stocks in Europe, Asia tumble Bonds boosted as investors favor havens U.S. stocks rose in choppy trade Tuesday after shock waves from its biggest-ever daily point plunge rippled through financial markets, sparking steep selloffs in equity benchmarks from Tokyo to Madrid.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average added 90 points, or 0.4%, to 24436, after it dropped nearly 1,600 points at one point Monday and erased its gains for the year. The S&P 500 gained 0.1%, and the Nasdaq Composite...
